=== Description ===

Nagios is an opensource monitoring system which is very scalable and configurable. Nagios can do local and remote monitoring of system using modules that are easily created by administrators. It has advance concepts such as contact hierarchy and system/network dependencies. 

=== Installation ===

* Install nagios package on the nagios server: 
<pre> 
sudo apt-get install nagios3 
</pre>
** Set the password for the user nagiosadmin on the web interface of nagios
* Go to http://nagios_ip/nagios3 in your browser and login with the nagios user

=== Configuration ===

=== Configuring a remote server for monitorization with npre ===
==== On the remote server ====
Install the requiered packages
<pre>
apt-get install nagios-plugins nagios-nrpe-server nagios-nrpe-plugin
</pre>

Edit /etc/nagios/nrpe_local.cfg with the following content
<pre>
allowed_hosts=NAGIOS.SERVER.IP,127.0.0.1

command[check_users]=/usr/lib/nagios/plugins/check_users -w 5 -c 10
command[check_load]=/usr/lib/nagios/plugins/check_load -w 15,10,5 -c 30,25,20
command[check_all_disks]=/usr/lib/nagios/plugins/check_disk -w 20 -c 10
command[check_zombie_procs]=/usr/lib/nagios/plugins/check_procs -w 5 -c 10 -s Z
command[check_total_procs]=/usr/lib/nagios/plugins/check_procs -w 150 -c 200
command[check_swap]=/usr/lib/nagios/plugins/check_swap -w 20 -c 10
</pre>

Save and exit. Then restart the service:
<pre>
service nagios-nrpe-server restart
</pre>
Test igf the service is working with the following command:
<pre>
 /usr/lib/nagios/plugins/check_nrpe -H localhost
</pre>

==== On the nagios server ====
<pre>
apt-get install nagios-nrpe-plugin
</pre>
